;Girls hallucinate after smoking dust cans. (Nong Jian/Picture)

;

;The night Chen Minru was burned by the fire, she had a hallucination: a disheveled monster slowly approached with a rolling electric saw. A pair of red eyes stared at Chen Minru's best friend.

;

;"I quickly protected my bestie, which scared me to tears." When I woke up in the middle of the night, nothing happened. Chen Minru looked around and saw that most of the people in the room were already asleep. Eight young people under the age of 20 were crammed into three beds, seven women and one man, four of whom were underage. The high-pressure gas dust canisters they had just smoked were scattered all over the floor.

;

;High-pressure gas dust removal tank, a liquid spray device used to clean computer keyboards, cameras or dead corners of dust in car interiors. The main component is HFC cleaning gas, which is sprayed In an instant, the liquid will turn into a strong airflow. Its slogan reads: The airflow is strong enough to easily blow a 132-gram mouse.

;

;On the evening of June 17, 2023, eight people, including Chen Minru, smoked dust canisters in Room 501 of Rulan Hotel in Shangluo City, Shaanxi Province. "Sucking that thing can cause hallucinations." 17-year-old Chen Minru told Southern Weekend reporters that the gas emitted from the dust removal canister smells astringent and is not easy to inhale. "When I started smoking that day, my face still hurt a little, and then I started hallucinating. I woke up and wanted to smoke."

;

;Chen Minru didn't pay attention to the bottle of the dust collector. Instructions: Do not expose to environments above 40 degrees Celsius, and do not throw into fire. The product description also states: Keep away from heat sources to prevent the can from exploding. That day, there were forty or fifty bottles of dust removal cans in the room, some of which had not been finished.

;

;At about 3 o'clock in the morning on the 18th, Chen Minru pressed the lighter, and 19-year-old Guo Zhen was sleeping soundly in the next bed. The fate of the two girls was completely reversed. , the two families behind them fell into the abyss together.

;

;“I forgot how many cans I smoked”

;

;First, the light on the ceiling exploded with a bang. Chen Minru's face was closest to the lighter and caught fire first, rolling around on the ground crying.

;

;Several girls woke up one after another, with sparks lighting up on their bodies, and they ran around the room anxiously. The door couldn't be opened, so they ran into the bathroom and turned on the shower. "But the water was hot, scalding, so we ran out again," Chen Minru recalled.

;

;Guo Zhen is still asleep, and her reaction is much slower. Afterwards, she recalled that when she was picked up by a good friend, she was still in a daze and lost her mind when she saw the fire in front of her. The curtains and quilts against the wall were full of fire, and they burned more and more intensely. It wasn't until about 10 minutes later, when Guo Zhen opened the door that was locked from the inside, that he noticed that his hands had turned out and his knuckles were clearly visible.

;

;This scene was photographed by residents in the building opposite the hotel. A video taken that night showed a raging fire coming out of the window of Room 501, and the crackling sounds were mixed with the girls' calls for help. Eight people ran down the stairs from the fifth floor and stopped a patrolling police car on the road. Ambulances and fire engines arrived later.

;

;;

;

;In the early morning of June 18, 2023, Residents near the scene took photos of the fire. (Photo provided by interviewee)

;

;It was past 6 o'clock in the morning, and Chen Shuai had not yet entered the door of the emergency room of Shangluo Central Hospital. He was far away; I smelled the smell of burning skin, "My hair was so fried that I couldn't even recognize who it was";. ;Eight burnt-black children lay on stretchers, spread out in a row. Chen Shuai saw a red-haired girl and was sure it was his sister Chen Minru.

;

;Guo Zhen’s mother He Weili came earlier. Guo's father recalled that at 4 a.m. on June 18, his wife received a call from the police saying that her daughter was in the hospital. She rushed in and hugged a girl and cried. Guo Zhen next to him made a trembling voice, "Mom, I'm here," and then fainted.

;

;The doctor diagnosed that among the eight people, Chen Minru and Guo Zhen had the most serious burns, and they were recommended to be sent to a large hospital in Xi'an for treatment. Their burn wounds were distributed on the head and face, front and rear trunks and limbs, and the grades were all between II and III. The burn area of ​​Chen Minru's body surface was as high as 75%, and that of Guo Zhen was 60%-69%, both of which were extremely severe burns.

;

;The remaining 6 people suffered minor injuries. The mildest one only injured the skin of the calf, and you could go out for activities the next day. Five people suffered burns all over their limbs, and they have been healing by applying medicine at home.

;

;A girl with burnt limbs concluded that there are two "culprits", one is the cigarette lighter, and the other is Xu Kexin who organized everyone to smoke dust cans .

;

;Xu Kexin, a 15-year-old girl from rural Shangluo. People in the circle who hang out with her say that Xu Kexin's family is poor, but she has never been short of money since she came out to join the society early, and her food and clothing are of a much higher standard than those in her circle.

;

;"She said, she smoked 'Mrs. Shuang' and let me try it." In early 2023, when Guo Zhen was playing with Xu Kexin in Xi'an, he touched the high-pressure dust removal tank for the first time. The smell was so disgusting that I couldn't inhale it, but I finally came to accept it."

;

;She also saw Xu Kexin smoking from another unnamed aluminum can. "It was a very big can. She said that after smoking it, it felt much better than a dust can."

;

;;

;

;Shangluo, Shaanxi, where the dust tank explosion occurred. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;Guo Zhen recalled that on the night of the incident, Xu Kexin "couldn't wait any longer and really wanted to smoke", so she booked a room at the Rulan Hotel and invited her friends to come over and smoke together. I placed two orders for the dust removal canister. I bought it in stock in the same city at a high price of 80 yuan per can, and it was quickly delivered to the hotel room.

;

;"It costs about ten yuan to buy a bottle online, but it costs 80 yuan to buy it from others." On the evening of October 9, Xu Kexin told me on the phone A reporter from Southern Weekend said that he bought forty or fifty dust removal cans that night. “That thing makes me want to sleep as soon as I hit it. I forgot how many cans I smoked.”; ;

;

;;“I can’t control it, there’s nothing I can do”;

;

;On the afternoon of October 9, a Southern Weekend reporter walked into Chen Minru's ward and was greeted by a strong smell of burn cream. She was supporting the board with her elbows and heels, lifting her bandaged legs in turn, and slowly moved laterally to the hospital bed by the window, so that she could be closer to the sun.

;

;This is the 4th month after Chen Minru was burned. Her body has been skin grafted twice, and her face is covered with pitted scars. ;The skin; is as solid as plastic. surface, even reflective. This is completely different from the girl with lively eyes in her circle of friends and short video account.

;

;In the video, Chen Minru has fair skin, big eyes, and pouty lips. She has a figure that is envied by her friends. She is 165cm tall and likes to wear short shorts and JK uniforms.

;

;;

;

;Photo of Chen Minru before being burned. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;Guo Zhen was lying on bed No. 30, two wards away from Chen Minru, with his whole body covered with gauze, except for his arms and The hand can move to a small extent, but other parts cannot move at all. Like Chen Minru, she was dressed exquisitely in short videos in the past, and there was no hint of her ordinary family background.

;

;"This is posted by people who live in a mixed society and do not learn well." In 2022, Chen Shuai added his sister WeChat for the first time, browsed the circle of friends, and felt She has changed a lot.

;

;Chen Minru has two brothers. 23-year-old Chen Shuai is the eldest, but Chen Minru and her brothers have not seen each other several times since they were young. In 2009, when Chen Minru was 3 years old, her father was imprisoned for a crime. Her mother, Pan Yafang, was so stimulated that she became mentally ill and the family fell apart.

;

;"My grandma took her two brothers to her hometown. They favored boys over girls and didn't want me." Living a wandering life with Pan Yafang made Chen Minru often hate herself. She stared at the ceiling of the ward and shed tears, "Everyone in my family hates me, so I shouldn't have been born in this family."; ;When Chen Minru’s grandmother heard about it, she cried and explained, “The family’s conditions are not good and we can’t afford to support her.”

;

;When Chen Minru was five years old, she followed Pan Yafang by train to Xi’an to make a living. . Xi'an is too big, and Pan Yafang only knows the old train station. The mother and daughter live at the foot of the city wall next to the train station, filling their stomachs with food every day at the aid station that helps homeless people. After wandering for a period of time, Pan Yafang would take her daughter back to Shangluo and stay with her sister or brother. She had no money and was reluctant to spend money. Chen Minru claimed to have learned how to steal money from relatives.

;

;Pan Yafang always has disheveled hair, a touch of chicken blood, and three strings of colorful plastic beads on her wrists and neck. These are all magic weapons she begged from the temple to ward off evil spirits. Chen Minru said that her mother did not know how to cook and did not live at home. She often danced outside. As a result, Chen Minru was lost for more than ten days. She lost her footing and fell into a pool, almost choking to death.

;

;"This is not a home at all, it feels like a stranger." Living in a muddle, Chen Minru became a typical rebellious girl, she described I am "a bit of a mixed bag". I entered a vocational middle school through my relatives' connections. I don't want to go to school and often spend the night at my friends' houses.

;

;In 2022, Chen Shuai, who was working outside, returned to Shangluo and worked in a car factory to make money. He took the initiative to contact Chen Minru and had a serious chat. If Chen Minru was willing, he could assume the role of father. Chen Minru agreed without hesitation, "My brother said that he will do his best to control me until I am 18 years old."

;

;Chen Shuai restrained his sister's first One condition is that you don't want to hang out with people from society. Chen Minru obviously didn't listen. She would still skip classes to find friends. She also beat a fourteen-year-old or fifteen-year-old child so badly that the police called Chen Shuai after getting drunk. In Shaanxi dialect, he described his sister as a "second-rate person" with no brains.

;

;Guo Zenghu said that he also received many calls from the police station, all because of his daughter Guo Zhen. Either Guo Zhen asked a group of friends to beat others, or someone asked a group of friends to beat Guo Zhen. "He stayed like that all day and didn't study."; ;

;

;If this accident had not happened, Guo Zhen and Guo Zenghu would still be strangers. They had already verbally severed the relationship between father and daughter and had no relationship for two years. connect.

;

;"I can't control her. She has a boyish personality and is very wild." He Weili said that the couple had nothing to do with this daughter. Guo Zenghu was helpless. He was 57 years old and still had to worry about his daughter. "If I can't control it, I won't be called to come here. I won't come back for a year and a half."

;

;Since he was 17 years old, Guo Zhen ran away from home. I worked several jobs, and finally worked as a waiter at a bar with two friends. Guo Zenghu didn't know about Guo Zhen's early smoking and drinking, but he wasn't surprised when he heard, "In rural areas, people make different kinds of friends. They are like this in their circle. It's okay to just follow those kids." Good habits”;. ;

;

;;;

;

;;;

;On October 9, 2023, in Shangluo, Shaanxi, He Weili took care of Guo Zhen for dinner. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;“I just don’t want to go home”

;

;That was not the case at first. Guo Zenghu missed Guo Zhen when he was a child, "very well-behaved, very well-behaved."

;

;When Guo Zhen was six or seven years old, he would clean the house. When Guo Zenghu and his wife came back from planting corn in the fields, their little daughter would bring them face wash. Once, when Xiao Guo Zhen was helping to boil water, he accidentally put his arm into the iron pot of boiling water and burned a large area of ​​his arm.

;

;"What I value most is this daughter." The Guo family has three daughters. In the past, family conditions were not good, and the eldest dropped out of school midway through school; He was sent to a relative's home for foster care. Finally, there is the third child, Guo Zhen. Guo Zenghu is determined to raise his little daughter well without leaving any regrets. "I will let her study hard. Whatever she can learn, the family will do everything possible to show it."; ;

;

;Guo Zhen is also quite successful. After elementary school, he was admitted to the best private junior high school in Shangluo. Guo Zenghu moved his family from the countryside to the city. During the high school entrance examination, Guo Zhen was admitted to Shangluo Middle School, the best local school. However, within a year, he was expelled from the school for fighting. Guo Zenghu hates that iron cannot be made into steel, "The two women often said that I was partial and thought that I valued Guo Zhen the most, but I didn't expect that it would end up like this."

;

;"I came from my hometown to study in the city and turned bad. ." In Guo Zenghu's impression, the junior high school teacher notified him several times to go to school and suggested that Guo Zhen transfer to another school, stop being in the city, and just make some friends.

;

;But in Guo Zhen's view, this matter became a knot in her mind because she was afraid of Guo Zenghu. Since elementary school, she has not dared to let her father attend parent-teacher meetings, fearing that he would lose his temper after hearing bad comments. Whenever he couldn't solve a question, Guo Zenghu picked up the broom and chased her in front of many people.

;

;After the junior high school teacher reported the problem, Guo Zenghu’s attitude became more severe. "My dad started scolding me, and I had to stare at the book every day. I was very good at that time, but the teacher said that I was hanging out with the second-rate people in the outside world, and wouldn't let my good friends play with me, and kept targeting me. "Guo Zhen said, feeling aggrieved.

;

;During that time, the teacher assigned a lot of homework, and Guo Zhen gradually became more and more stressed. "I am not good at studying, so they don't understand. If I don't do well in the exam, I will When it comes to me, I don’t praise myself for passing the exam, I have no motivation, and I feel like I can’t stay at home. In addition, I fell in love with someone in class, and we had a quarrel, so I cried all night.”

;

;She began to suffer from insomnia frequently, and was frightened by nightmares in the middle of the night. She screamed nonsense, and took the initiative to show He Weili the scars on her wrists. "Mom, what if I jump into the reservoir and a fish bites me?" "I What if I climb to the roof and survive the fall but become disabled?”

;

;He Weili has never studied. She doesn’t understand this, so she takes her daughter to Xi’an. I spent eight to nine thousand yuan to see a doctor in a big hospital, but no problem was found. "The doctor said that the baby is under too much pressure and the family is too strict. If the baby is given some time and space to relax, it might be better." He Weili guessed that the baby has been beaten and scolded by her father since she was a child, which made her depressed.

;

;The burn scar on his arm when he was a child was covered up by Guo Zhen quietly ;writing; a pattern in a non-mainstream style. The pattern is of a scarred two-headed teddy bear. One head has an expressionless face, and the other head has empty eyes wide open, revealing a mouth of fangs.

;

;;

;

;Guo Zhen’s pattern on the arm scar. (Southern Weekend reporter Zheng Dan/Photo)

;

;After Guo Zhen's emotional problems, Guo Zenghu also had a headache, "I'm stupid and the baby is a girl. I don't know what to do." Communicate." In this way, Guo Zhen was "relaxed." He found that his daughter's temper was getting worse and worse. "I hit her lightly, and she wanted to make the building collapse and jump off it again. In the end, she didn't even come into the house. As soon as I talked about her, she went out to live. She didn't answer the phone calls and didn't reply to messages. You think this is the last thing. What can we do?"

;

;It wasn't until Guo Zhen was expelled from Shangluo Middle School when she was in her first year of high school that Guo Zenghu beat her again and proposed to sever the relationship between father and daughter.

;

;"He not only beat me, but also called my sister to come back and beat me. My sister hit me on the head with a lamp." After the beating, Guo Zhen moved out Every time He Weili asked her to go home, she would first ask if her father was at home. "He only knows how to curse, and keeps hitting me, slapping me, and hitting me with a stick. Anyway, he just doesn't want to go home."

;

;One ​​day, Guo Zenghu bumped into me on the road. When he got to Guo Zhen, whom he had lost contact with for a long time, he slapped her several times in public. For the first time, Guo Zhen had the idea of ​​fighting back, so she called the police.

;

;When mentioning this incident, Guo Zhen cried so hard that he couldn't breathe. ;He; Wei Li on the side was ;very; surprised. She had never seen her daughter shed a single tear after the dust canister explosion accident.

;

;;A downtrodden family;

;

;Guo Zhen saw Guo Zenghu, who always had a straight face, cried every day. "He lay next to me and looked at me every day, and cried as he watched."

;

;"The hospital began to say that the hope was not very high." Guo Zenghu recalled, When he first went to the hospital in Xi'an, the doctor told him to be mentally prepared because Guo Zhen's lungs were severely burned.

; After the skin was removed, the skin was still eroded. "The more I look at it, the more hopeless it becomes. The worst-case scenario is that I want to jump off the building, but I can't hold it up anymore."; ;

;

;Guo Zhen took the initiative to give up the treatment, "I don't want to be treated anymore, you can go back and don't worry about me";. ;

;

;"I really don't want to care about her, but ;she; is my woman after all, so I can't bear to leave her." Guo Zenghu really didn't Qian continued his treatment. He was just a worker working at a construction site. During chestnut harvesting season, he collected chestnuts everywhere. He had saved less than 100,000 yuan over the years, and raised more than 300,000 yuan with relatives. It was not enough to put it all in. .

;

;Chen Shuai experienced exactly the same suffering as Guo Zenghu. After Chen Minru's accident, he borrowed money from all the relatives he knew and didn't know to collect 400,000 yuan. After staying in the hospital for 40 days in Xi'an, he couldn't afford it anymore, so he had to take his sister back to Shangluo Central Hospital for continued treatment. Later, he owed more than 40,000 yuan to Shangluo Central Hospital. After being urged to pay the fee over and over again by the hospital, he stopped going to the hospital, and Chen Minru was forced to stop taking medicine.

;

;"If she learns well, I will give her my life, but she won't obey." Chen Shuai retracted his head ;in; his collar, The voice is deep. At first, the 23-year-old boy refused to be interviewed several times. He wanted to be cruel and stay away from everything about his sister.

;

;Over the years, Chen Shuai's performance is actually not much better than Chen Minru's. Although it has been taken over by grandparents, it is also in a free-range state. At the age of 8, he followed the second-rate kids into the supermarket to steal snacks to satisfy his hunger. When he grew up, he spent all day in Internet cafes just to have a place to live. At the age of 13, he started working outside to make money on his own.

;

;Approaching this strange sister made his already tight life even worse. In just one year, Chen Minru first fell seriously into a ditch while riding an electric bicycle. She fainted and was admitted to the hospital several times because of her weak body. Once Chen Minru had an appendicitis attack, and the operation cost 20,000 to 30,000 yuan, which was all handled by Chen Shuai. What made him especially heartbroken was that Chen Minru was absent from class without telling him.

;

;"She said she went to school. I asked the teacher, and the teacher said she didn't go. She didn't go home, she just hung out." Chen Shuai was furious, "As long as you tell me that you don't want me to care about you, I will never care about you in the future."; ;Chen Minru also had a firm attitude and replied, "Don't worry about me." Since then, the two have lost contact.

;

;Until the day before the incident, the Dragon Boat Festival was approaching. Chen Shuai had not seen Chen Minru for two months. He took the initiative to send a message saying that his family had made rice dumplings. Chen Minru also hoped that the relationship between brother and sister could be eased and promised to go back to her hometown to eat rice dumplings in two days.

;

;The brother and sister met again in the hospital. Chen Shuai hated and felt sorry for this sister, "At that time, I really wanted to leave her alone. This was all She did it herself";. ;

;

;The fire caused by the dust can completely overwhelmed Chen Shuai. He quit his job, sold his motorcycle worth 13,000 yuan, was almost penniless, and had a debt of more than 400,000 yuan. Even if he didn't go to the hospital, his mother and sister would have to rely on him for food and money. He had no intention of looking for a job anymore. He slept during the day and thought wildly at night. He felt that life was hazy. "I don't know what I should do now, and I have no motivation to do anything."; ;

;

;Regret and nostalgia

;

;For a moment, Guo Zenghu thought that his deviant daughter was about to get back on track, "There needs to be someone." That’s it.”

;

;"On the afternoon of the accident, she called the cargo puller and moved all the large and small boxes of things back." Guo Zenghu heard his daughter say that he would be in Live at home. "When I saw it, she didn't live outside anymore. She seemed to have changed her mind."

;

;What Guo Zhen didn't tell Guo Zenghu was that she was kicked out by the landlord. , because Xu Kexin always takes her friends to play in rental houses. That night, after Guo Zhen went out, He Weili made several calls to ask her to go home, but Guo Zhen still didn't answer.

;

;The real change of heart is in the hospital bed. Guo Zhen told her father again and again that she really knew she was wrong. But when he learned that Guo Zhen would still keep in touch with Xu Kexin, Guo Zenghu was so angry that he scolded Guo Zhen again and again for his unrepentance. "She still hasn't repented of herself and is still in contact with those people. Now I just want to do my best to take good care of the baby. After she is cured, she will do whatever she likes, and I won't care about her."

;

;But for Guo Zhen, she only has these friends. They all come from rural areas and have similar family backgrounds and preferences. "I am happy to be with them. Say whatever you want to say." What, do whatever you want to do”;. ;

;

;"She didn't listen to me." Guo Zenghu was scared just thinking about it. The hospital said that Guo Zhen would not be able to return to normal skin after recovery.

;

;"For girls, the most important thing is their face." After the accident, Chen Minru, who was originally talkative, became ;rejected; into a man of few words. She was particularly worried about the disfigurement, and kept thinking about the past scenes in her mind. She obviously had many opportunities to avoid this disaster.

;

;"I don't know how to smoke that thing, and I can't light it up." Chen Minru said.

;

;"If time could go back to the past, I would not come back from Jiangsu." The day before the incident, Chen Minru had just returned to Shangluo from an internship in Jiangsu. It is said to be an internship, but it is actually a summer labor dispatch job arranged by the vocational school. She was sent to a television factory by her school. She wore dustproof clothing and stood on the assembly line in the workshop for 12 hours every day, from 7:00 in the morning to 7:30 in the evening. After two months, she earned More than 5,000 yuan. To her, this was a huge sum of money.

;

;Although the days of working were hard, the staff dormitory was spacious and life was smooth. After thinking about it, Chen Minru also regretted why she didn't listen to her brother's words in the first place. "It was too confusing at the time. I got used to that state over time."; ;

;

;After being transferred back to Shangluo from Xi'an for hospitalization, Chen Minru heard about a similar accident that happened in Shangluo. A group of children gathered together to smoke dust cans. One of them, a 13-year-old boy, swallowed 40 pills in order to seek happiness. "It is said that the hallucinations he had were particularly terrifying. They were all green, happy and painful."< span>;. ;

;

;In the end, the boy huddled on the ground, twitching all over, foaming at the mouth, and asked his friends to call 120. "A few other people didn't dare call the police. When they finally dared to call an ambulance, the person was already dead when they arrived at the hospital." Chen Minru sighed, "At least I'm still alive, so I'm lucky."

;

;But she quickly changed her mind. Every night, every inch of skin and bones in the body aches. What made her even more uncomfortable was that her mother, who had no ability to live independently, did not know how to take care of others. She was chatty and kept talking about herself. She would also suddenly lose control of her emotions, pointing at Chen Minru and yelling at her for having no conscience, and quarreling in the ward. Continuously.

;

;"I might as well just die." Chen Minru turned her head away, tears overflowed, and she shouted with all her strength, "Can you see how pitiful I am, and don't do it again?" You're talking about me." But after calming down, Chen Minru felt distressed again when she saw Pan Yafang eating moldy leftovers, "I have hated her during these years of wandering, but it's not easy for her to drag me down so much."; ;

;

;On the evening of October 21st, Chen Minru posted a post on Moments. It was a video taken with her best friend. In the video, she puffed out her cheeks. , a cute pet filter is added to the tip of the nose, shaking the head and looking cute. She wrote three words: "I miss you very much."

;On October 22, Song Kai, the new chairman of the Chinese Football Association, made it clear at a symposium that "the Chinese Football Association will never We can no longer introduce weird policies, this is the bottom line, and the policies introduced must meet social expectations." This statement aroused widespread attention and heated discussion.

;

;What Song Kai is facing this time when he takes office is that the aftermath of the anti-corruption storm in football is raging, and all walks of life are annoyed and critical of Chinese football. Chinese football is still at a low point.

;

;Song Kai’s speech that “no weird policies can be made” has won him a lot of praise. There is no other reason. In the past few years, the Chinese Football Association has launched many bizarre policies that achieve half the result with half the effort or even be counterproductive. Take the "New Policy for U23 (Under 23) Players" launched by the Football Association in the past few years as an example. The original intention of this policy is to allow young players to get more playing time in the league and to cultivate more outstanding domestic players. However, in the process from policy formulation to implementation, the outside world has witnessed a farce of "weird and unlimited".

;

;In the 2017 professional league season, the Chinese Football Association’s regulations are that there must be two U23 players in the 18-man roster, and one of them must start. As a result, in order to ensure results first, each team implemented the operation of "replacing young players when they come on" and "replacing them in stoppage time to improve data".

;

;In the 2018 season, the Football Association upgraded this policy to "the number of U23 players playing must not be less than the number of foreign players playing." This policy ultimately backfired. Each team would rather not recruit foreign players than give U23 players a chance. How to arrange U23 players to appear on the court to "brush data" has even become an "arithmetic problem" for the coaches of each team. In 2023, the U23 policy has to be cancelled. Over the course of six or seven years, this policy became a typical example of "mission creep," with goals and means completely out of touch and a huge waste of resources.

;

;The weird thing about the U23 policy is that it goes against the fundamental laws of football and the market laws of professional leagues. If young players are capable, they can get playing time without the help of policies; young players who are incompetent will not win the starting position even if they are given time forcibly. Forcibly asking for "given opportunities" seems to be training young players, but in the end it hurts everyone's interests. Not only did this operation of forcibly converting effects into causes arouse ridicule from the outside world, but the process of removing seedlings to encourage growth also yielded a lot of feathers.

;

;The U23 policy is just one of the many weird policies of the Chinese Football Association. Therefore, if you want the work of the Chinese Football Association to "comply with social expectations" and if you want to do a good job in Chinese football, what you should consider is not necessarily "what the Chinese Football Association should do", but "what the Chinese Football Association should not do". I'm afraid this This is the lesson that the new Football Association leadership team should remember.

;

;Judging from Song Kai's speech, "no weird policies" is the keynote of the argument, and he also has the vision of "the youth competition system must remain stable", showing his ambition to bring order to things. In fact, by extending this line of thought, we can also think deeply about what kind of binary relationship the "Chinese Football Association" and "Chinese Football" should have in order to better meet social expectations. Or to put it more directly, can we really only rely on the Chinese Football Association to improve Chinese football? The answer is probably not so.

;

;To evaluate whether a country's football is prosperous, we cannot simply use the national team's performance as the criterion. In addition, there are many fields such as the league system, football industry, and football culture. In these areas, a national football association does not have the ability to take over everything, nor does it have the power to issue orders. It is completely unreasonable to expect that football in a country can be revitalized by administrative hands.

;

;Football is a very scientific sport. Only by returning to objective laws can we truly improve football, and this requires the joint efforts of the whole society. The Chinese Football Association still should not overestimate its own capabilities, let alone artificially expand its own power, hoping that it can fundamentally improve such a huge compound concept as "Chinese Football" on its own. Rather than saying that the goal of the Chinese Football Association is to be a good manager of Chinese football, it is better to say that it should strive to be a good service provider, do a good job in administrative services, let private football institutions make their own decisions, and let the market judge the choice.

;

;In fact, Chinese football does not lack a folk foundation. The high attendance rate of the Chinese Super League and the popularity of the "Village Super League" all show the potential of Chinese football culture and the possibilities of the football industry. What the Chinese Football Association should do is respect the autonomy and self-construction of the private football system, and at least not use "weird policies" to destroy the football soil that is still growing.

;

;Argentine star Valdano once said, “Football does not belong to any one person. Everyone must have a sense of ownership of this wonderful sport, and football also needs everyone to have a little control over it. Otherwise, excessive concentration of power will inevitably lead to corruption. Even in the football industry, no one can surpass this law." From the separation of management and management to "good service", the Chinese Football Association's statement of "no weird policies" is just a step forward The first step is to hand over this wonderful sport of football to everyone who loves football.

;

;;

;

;An infrared camera captured a wild giant panda passing by;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;"Don't doubt my skills."

;

;Zhong Junde, a legendary hunter from Pingwu County, Mianyang, Sichuan, squinted his eyes and pointed The opposite hillside. His hair was gray, and his thin body looked very flexible. When he was talking proudly, he would squint his eyes, stand up from the back of the chair, and cross his legs.

;

;"There's a wild boar there," he said.

;

;It was calm on the hillside.

;

;"If you stay one more day, I will kill the wild boar for you right away."

;

;The old man is joking again. Now, if anyone is hunting in this mountain, they will definitely avoid him.

;

;Before the legendary hunter Zhong Junde was imprisoned for reselling panda skins, he hunted forest musk deer, tufted deer, "four different species", as well as countless muntjacs and wild boars. At the peak of his career as a hunter, he and his accomplices knocked down nine takin in three days and harvested a total weight of more than three tons of meat.

;

;Now, he is the captain of the Xinyi Village patrol team, leading a group of former hunters to patrol the mountains. They know very well what should be in the forest and what should not be there.

;

;“We are absolutely sure in which season to set hunting snares and in which season to fight against poaching.” He said, “Know them (them) as well as you know yourself.”

; < p>;;

;

;Zhong Junde shows off the crossbow he used to hunt. ;(Liu Hui/Photo);

;

;;Hunters, villages and mountains and forests;

;

;"Eat on the mountain "Mountain", hunting has a long history in mountainous areas, and Pingwu is no exception.

;

;Hunters possess unique knowledge of nature. They master 72 kinds of spells and can divide the mountains into yin, yang, male and female according to the movement trajectory of the sun. In their eyes, the mountains are not made of soil and vegetation but are spliced ​​together by the movement trajectories of different animals. The mud rolls Falling and swaying vegetation are simply meant to reveal the movement of animals.

;

;"Tibetans eat tsampa, and we Han people like to eat dry rice. The same goes for animals." The old hunter understands wild animals the same way he understands humans: takin like to eat leaves on the treetops, and furry ones on the cliffs. Grass, so they have to stay in Yinshan; but muntjac and tufted deer like Yangshan. Giant pandas are a little more complicated. They move with the seasons: from May to July, they run all over the mountains looking for fresh bamboo shoots; in hot weather, they like to sit in the mountains; in winter, because they want to give birth, they look for half-baked bamboo shoots. In a place that is yin and half yang, there is water, food, and sunlight.

;

;;

;

;The tufted deer at the Laohegou Nature Conservation Center. ;(Wu Yuchen/Picture);

;

;Zhong Junde, who was born in 1961, thought that after he and his father shot a panda when he was 7 years old, Meaty, smelly animals are hard to swallow. Hunters at that time did not like to hunt pandas because of this, and sometimes they just encountered them.

;

;Takin are usually the most popular among hunters. When he was 14 years old, he learned that his father, who was busy reporting to the village to earn work points, had failed to kill a takin. Zhong Junde made an appointment with a friend, took a shotgun, and shot the takin where its front legs and chest were connected. The takin fell into an eternal sleep.

;

;Hunger and poverty can lead hunters to carry takin carcasses heavier than themselves. The corpse was packed in a hollow backpack made of palm tree fiber. The smell, similar to that of goat, would stay on the body of the person carrying the meat for a long time.

;

;In the 1980s, there was a sudden rush for panda skin and musk on the market. Some people once believed that musk had the effect of "reviving the dead" and that sleeping on panda skin could bring good luck. The men took their earthen cannons and bullets smelted from toothpaste lead and tramped through every bamboo forest and bush. Locals recalled that panda skins were once sold for a whopping price of 500,000 yuan a piece.

;

;What followed was a crackdown that lasted for many years. In 1987, the Supreme People's Court issued a judicial interpretation stating that reselling and smuggling panda skins could lead to the death penalty. However, the severe crackdown has not led to a sharp decrease in poaching. Xinyi Village is the hardest hit area for panda poaching. Of the more than 160 households in the village, more than 40 heads were arrested and imprisoned, making the village a so-called "widow's village."

;

;When many old hunters reminisce about the past, they will mention their life experiences before entering the jungle day and night: getting married, having children, and having children again. Faced with a life of poverty and the pressure of raising a family, men will not give up hunting easily - the mountains are their almost only reliance. How many cents does a pound of corn cost? How many yuan does it cost to work in a provincial capital every day? But what about musk? The price per gram is directly equivalent to gold.

;

;In Fushou Village, not far from Xinyi Village, hunter Qiang Qinggui became famous for capturing 13 forest musk deer in a row in one winter.

;

;;

;

;Qiang Qinggui shows off his abandoned hunting tools in Fushou Village, Pingwu County, Mianyang City. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Photo);

;

;Daily life in these villages is closely linked to hunting, and most villagers know about it even if they have not participated. Peeling off a panda's skin requires an incision under the panda's armpits to keep the fur intact; most people born before 2000 had eaten antelope beef, boiled or braised, at village banquets. People who eat beef have no reputation.”

;

;In a village where all boys go into the jungle to find prey, Gan Mingdong saw himself as a hunter since he was a child. He was born in Gaocun, Pingwu County, in 1994. There is only one street in the town that can be seen at a glance. His parents couldn't find any other way to survive, so they went out to work after he was 6 years old. The education his grandfather, a veteran, could give him was that his pocket money was two yuan a day, and "if there was a fight, give him five yuan."

;

;As the boys hunt together, excitement dominates their actions. After hunting prey, hormone secretion reaches its peak, and is strengthened through repeated competitions. But Gan Mingdong vaguely felt something strange. The moment he got the animal carcass, he would feel sad for no reason. But "the next time I hunted, I was even more ferocious and excited."

;

;He also disliked those who hunted just for fun or to improve their marksmanship. Although the elders who believed in Buddhism handed him a shotgun, they also told him: Only shoot meat when you have to eat it.

;

;Besides hunting, the only things left are love and fighting. The latter, fierce confrontation between people, is the main content of his life. He fights at least three times a week, collects protection money, and then gives the money, along with his mother's salary, to those whose bones he has broken.

;

;Gan Mingdong is known far and wide for his naughty nature. One time, his parents were not at home, so he couldn't get into the house and slept on the street all night. There were countless relatives and friends in the village, and no one gave him a meal. In the morning, he was woken up by wild dogs that kept coming to harass him. He went to the river dam to wash his face, shot a brown river crow with a slingshot, and roasted it.

;

;The village is like "a dead end", "the end of the world". People seek survival in the mountains and forests, and hunt as a guarantee and evidence of their own existence. The prey are like small gold mines scattered in the mountains, so densely distributed that no one would think that they would disappear one day.

;

;;"Panda or black bear, which one do you prefer?";

;

;In the eyes of another group of people in the world, the lives of "prey" are as equal as our own. .

;

;In 1996, Liu Xiaogeng, a student from Sichuan Agricultural University, graduated and came to work in Tangjiahe National Nature Reserve. His idea is very simple. In such a mature protected area, there are many foreign exchanges. I can learn advanced things from my foreign colleagues and use them for my use.

;

;Twenty-seven years later, looking back now, the "lesson" that impressed him most came from an American young man who did black bear protection in Minnesota. The other party asked: Do you prefer pandas or black bears?

;

;Liu Xiaogeng was speechless for a moment and made a hasty choice: Panda, which is cuter.

;

;The American young man said that I prefer the Asian black bear because the crescent-shaped spots on its body are very beautiful, much better than the crescent spots of the Minnesota black bear.

;

;Liu Xiaogeng discovered for the first time that a person's original intention to protect animals can be as simple as: liking it.

;

;In 1997, Wang Dezhi, a junior student majoring in environmental biology and ecology at Peking University, went to Qinling for an internship. On the hillside less than 200 meters away from the station, a wild giant panda was eating bamboo. This is the second daughter of the panda family studied by her tutor Professor Pan Wenshi. Professor Pan called its name softly: "Hope." "Hope" chewed and turned around.

;

;After 26 years, Wang Dezhi still remembers that moment: "A wild animal, a very calm look, had a huge impact on my heart."

;

;Original ambition Wang Dezhi, a forest farm boy studying microbiology, made a decision at that moment: "I want to do research on wild animals."

;

;For Pan Wenshi, a master of Chinese biology, "research" on wild animals actually means "Protect". What he often said in front of students was, "We do a lot of research and publish a lot of papers, but if this animal is gone, how useful will these studies be?"

;

;When he was a graduate student, Wang Dezhi followed Pan The professor studied white-headed langurs in Chongzuo, Guangxi for eight years. He and his classmates guarded a sugar cane field and used telescopes to observe the monkeys on the karst mountains. A little monkey that he has observed since birth, Wang Dezhi calls it "Yiyi". For a while, they disappeared one by one, until the villagers brought a little monkey whose right arm was broken off by a animal trap. Everyone used fire-tempered machetes to cut off Yiyi's remaining arm. He lay quietly in Wang Dezhi's arms throughout the whole process. Later, I fed it my favorite leaves, and each one stretched out his right hand habitually. That was another unforgettable moment for Wang Dezhi.

;

;“This kind of monkey lives on the rock wall, which is the most important way for it to avoid enemies. On the rock wall, you must climb on all four legs-grasp at three points to form a flat surface. The other (hand and foot) reaches the fourth point (to move)." Wang Dezhi said, "Losing that hand means that it can no longer live on the rock wall."

;

;One by one Became a creature walking on land. Not long after, it got lost and was never seen again.

;

;The locals set traps to capture this rare animal, perhaps hoping for some kind of "medicine". This made Wang Dezhi angry. But eight years of guarding the sugar cane fields made him gradually realize, "There is little value in simply blaming anyone. What should really be done is to find some opportunities so that both (people and animals) can live a better life." ."

;

;In 2011, Liu Xiaogeng was invited to Laohegou Forest Farm in Pingwu County to conduct a background survey. A new protected area was being planned. This is an area surrounded by the homes of legendary hunters. Zhong Junde and Qiang Qinggui both live around Laohegou.

;

;;

;

;Ma Jian, director of Laohegou Conservation Center. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Photo);

;

;Pingwu is known as the "No. 1 panda county in the world" and has built multiple protection areas within its jurisdiction. District, according to the results of the fourth national giant panda resource survey, there are 335 wild giant pandas in Pingwu. Laohegou State-owned Forest Farm is located in Gaocun Township, Pingwu County. It connects two national nature reserves, Tangjiahe (Sichuan) and Baishuijiang (Gan), and is equivalent to the giant panda corridor of several major reserves in the two provinces. Infrared cameras have captured images of giant panda mothers and their babies walking through the forest farm; at the end of 2011, images of wild giant pandas eating antelope beef at night were also captured here. Laohegou is a transportation thoroughfare for giant pandas and has a complex and diverse ecosystem. However, it was not within the jurisdiction of any protected area at the time, so it became a popular place for poaching.

;

;In Wang Dezhi’s view, the conservation value of Laohegou is self-evident. The core point of the hope that it can be built into a protected area is that historical conditions have given it natural protection opportunities. Since the 1970s, this area has been an old forest farm. There are no farmers living or grazing livestock. The environment is pure. The core threat to the ecology is poaching.

;

;After two years of background investigation, Liu Xiaogeng stayed.

;

;In 2012, the Western Sichuan Nature Conservation Foundation (Sichuan Taohuayuan Ecological Protection Foundation) signed a 50-year entrustment management agreement with Pingwu County. The Taohuayuan Foundation will raise funds to be fully responsible for the ecology of the public welfare protected area. In terms of protection work, Laohegou became the first pilot project in China where the government entrusted the management of protected areas to private organizations.

;

;The Taohuayuan Foundation was initiated by well-known Chinese entrepreneurs, artists, and philanthropists and focuses on non-profit environmental protection of nature reserves. As of 2023, the foundation manages six protected areas in five provinces, with a total area of ​​527 square kilometers.

;

;In 2013, the Taohuayuan Foundation registered and established the Laohegou Nature Conservation Center in Pingwu County, with Liu Xiaogeng as director. Wang Dezhi also joined as chief scientist and became one of the planners of Laohegou Reserve. He hopes to seize the opportunity here for both people and animals to live better.

;

;;"Utopia";

;

;Brother Chen seems to have been looking after Lao Hegou for half his life.

;

;Chen Xianghui, born in 1971, is a native of the local area. Everyone calls him "Second Brother". When he was young, his second brother inherited his father's business and entered Laohegou Forest Farm. In the 1990s, he watched thick birch trees fall down in front of him and sold them to various places at a price of 500 yuan per cubic meter. After a few years of such an ordinary life, the second brother suddenly discovered that the forest farm where he was supposed to take care of his whole life, like his father, was empty. "The trees were all newly planted, and there was not a single animal in sight." .

;

;In 1998, China began to implement a natural forest protection project and stopped logging operations in the area. Forest farm workers faced tremendous pressure. Brother Chen also tried to go out to work, went to Guangdong, and later returned to Pingwu County, and finally returned to the forest farm: "You are from this place, you have to rush back."

;

;In the first few years of the 21st century In 2007, the second brother guarded the empty forest farm, eating three meals a day, accompanied by the TV, and his life was even emptier than the forest farm. Morels sprouted on the roadside, and fresh bamboo shoots grew on the mountains, but he didn't even bother to touch them.

;

;The story took a turn after a phone call. In 2011, Brother Chen received a call saying that an organization wanted to establish a protected area in the forest farm, and he immediately agreed to join. He has seen people from Wanglang Reserve (also in Pingwu County) wearing jackets and outdoor shoes that are "so majestic and enviable" and have income that ignites hope in life.

;

;;

;

;After dark, ranger Chen Xianghui leads a team to watch wild animals at night. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Photo);

;

;The first group to investigate were experts on amphibians and reptiles from the Chengdu Chinese Academy of Sciences. The second group is from the Wuhan Institute of Aquatic Biology... He follows these teachers, helping to drive, helping to make traps to mark animals, and then helping to release them after weighing them. Life has real content, and the days go by very fast.

;

;"I will follow the protection center wholeheartedly," said the second brother. At the end of March 2013, while hiking over the mountains with people from the conservation center, my second brother discovered an animal excrement that he had never seen before, and immediately called an expert for consultation. A few days later, he took 12 infrared cameras into the mountain and set them up. A month later, he checked the photos and called the leader of the county forestry bureau on the spot: We have photographed a tiger here! The other party replied: Tiger is a hammer! Do you know Shaanxi's "Zhou Laohu"?

;

;"I knew it was a golden cat, so I just made him happy." The taciturn second brother made a rare joke. As long as he could remember, he occasionally heard from old people that there were "leopards" in the mountains, "actually golden cats." This was the first time he had seen this species.

;

;Liu Xiaogeng and various experts conducted two years of background surveys. At the peak, forty or fifty scholars gathered here to study 13 different categories of animals. The survey identified seven main categories of protected objects represented by giant pandas and their habitats, as well as poaching, the biggest threat to the ecology. The root cause "lies in the pressure on villagers' lives and development outside the protected areas."

;

;As one of the designers of the blueprint for the Peach Blossom Spring Conservation Area, Wang Dezhi recalled that the founding team conceived a conservation plan for Laohegou that was entirely based on scientism. "On the one hand, the protected area should be managed in the most scientific way; on the other hand, such a great conservation plan mainly advocates not only paying attention to the interior of the protected area, but also paying attention to the villages outside the protected area (Fushou Village, Xinyi Villages are included), they are an extension of protection. This design also won a British award," Wang Dezhi said, "At that time, I thought the design was simply a utopia, so beautiful."

;

; In the excitement, the scientists did not realize that in the eyes of the villagers, their work had a different meaning.

;

;;Becoming a neighbor;

;

;As early as his student days, Wang Dezhi had experienced the melancholy of an ecological protector through repeated communications with farmers in protected areas. and loss.

;

;In the eight years they spent in Chongzuo, Guangxi, to the monkeys, Wang Dezhi and the others were observers; to the aborigines, the wall between the protectors and them had never been broken. Wang Dezhi believes that protecting the ecology at that time would only start from the "appearance" - locals hunted monkeys in order to use their bones to make wine to treat joint diseases, so Pan Wenshi promoted the upgrading of the local health center; in order to retain the trees on the mountain, the team Promote the construction of biogas digesters; in addition, we also helped build a local primary school. Starting from education, we hope to change the way people think about problems.

;

;The benefits of the outpouring of resources were immediate, with locals becoming "cooperative" - ​​in front of the protectors. Once the protector leaves, they will immediately abandon the methane pit and return to their accustomed habit of chopping wood and burning fires.

;

;In Laohegou, in order to get villagers around the reserve to give up hunting, the conservation center has also thought of many ways to try to find new sources of income for the villagers. But all of them took a turn for the worse after seemingly being successful. For example, when villagers were encouraged to standardize pig raising, the conservation center promised to purchase pigs at a price 20% higher than the market price. However, when it came to the acquisition, the villagers learned that they would not accept the pigs, let alone the African pigs. Sudden factors such as swine fever cannot be recycled.

;

;"People are full of opinions, saying that you guys lied to us." The protection center was also aggrieved, "Everyone is in a stage of exploration. How can we do business!"

;

;The conservation center also helped communities around the reserve build a mead factory. The directors of Taohuayuan paid a high price to buy the products and sold them to the directors at a high price. In the first year, the mead factory received a profit of 6.3 million yuan, half of which covered the cost and half of which He devoted himself to conservation work and achieved gratifying results. As a result, the business failed again the next year: "The directors reported that the wine was too unpleasant to drink."

;

;Business can’t be done, and Laohegou doesn’t look good. In Gouli, 26 patrol lines have been designed throughout the area, and more than 80 infrared camera locations have been deployed. But in the eyes of the villagers outside the ditch, Laohegou is the back mountain of their family. Going to the earth temple there to worship does not require anyone's permission. Whether killing chickens or burning incense, it has been their tradition and freedom for thousands of years. They board vans and come and go in groups, which puts pressure on the management and fire prevention of the protected area.

;

;The Conservation Center attempts to use local thinking to break down barriers. During the sacrifice, they also pooled their money to donate a chicken, "specifically saying that this is a chicken from the protected area." They also said that when working on the same piece of land, they should worship the same god.

;

;“Becoming a neighbor” is a set of ideas that are still being explored. In addition to anti-poaching in the reserve, rangers at the conservation center spend more than 400 hours doing community work every year. In the view of the foundation, most man-made threats to protected areas come from surrounding communities, and making friends with residents is the long-term way to discover, prevent, and eliminate man-made interference.

;

;In the protection center, everyone has to "go to the countryside" and visit the community. Ma Jian, the vice president of the foundation, lives in Shenzhen and is currently the director of the Laohegou Conservation Center. When he was in Laohegou, he was more like a village director: walking on the village road, nodding hello to the villagers, saying hello and pushing away the farmer's door familiarly. He opened the door and sat down on the bench. While eating melon seeds, he asked the host if the injury on his hand was feeling better and if his son and daughter had gone home during the Chinese New Year. "Has your son who is a chef gained weight? No, people say that if a chef is not fat, he is not a good cook."

;

;;

;

;Ma Jian visited the countryside in Fushou Village, Pingwu County. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Picture);

;

;Chatting is not the only purpose. Brother Chen, who is already the deputy director of the conservation center, can sometimes tell who is hunting secretly just by walking around the house. Once, he found goral hair in the crevices behind a farmer's house in Xinyi Village, and found pheasant feathers in the bushes. That night he took the village secretary to the farmer's house. Early the next morning, the farmer retrieved two more animal traps from the forest and handed them over.

;

;Since they are "neighbors", the relationship between the conservation center and the surrounding villages should also be to help each other. "People used to be suspicious. You fenced off the land and all the money was taken away by you." Ma Jian believes that the rangers need to understand the villagers, and the villagers also need to know what the people in the old river ditch are doing.

;

;In 2022, the conservation center will launch an ecological tour guide training. 115 villagers signed up for the first phase. After passing the training, the villagers will become tour guides and can take tourists as long as they comply with the management regulations of the national park. There is no need to pay money to the protected area to experience it, and the guided tour fee belongs to the individual villagers. If you violate the regulations, just like driver's license management, you will be deducted 6 points to retake training, and if you are deducted 12 points, your tour guide qualification will be suspended.

;

;How to brew mead is no longer the responsibility of the conservation center. They only do ecological planning to clarify the areas and quantities where bees can be kept. What should farmers do while complying with the regulations of the protected area? It just depends on their own abilities and wishes.

;

;When farming is busy, the conservation center will take time to help farmers harvest corn; villagers picked wild vegetables, pears, and persimmons, and also picked a few handfuls and sent them to the conservation center. Sometimes, several villages will jointly hold a banquet, and Laohegou must also put on a program like other villages, even though it is not an administrative division of a natural village.

;

;The effectiveness of this mutually beneficial neighborly relationship lies in the subtleties of daily life. Qiang Qinggui, who is fond of tobacco, will skillfully stub out the cigarette butt with his fingers and put it into his pocket after finishing smoking.

;

;"Don't litter, that's what Teacher Ma taught you," he said.

;

;;We still have to "live on the mountain";

;

;The key result of becoming neighbors is to unite the indigenous peoples and protect them together.

;

;In 2018, with the support of the Taohuayuan Foundation, Xinyi Village and Fushou Village in Pingwu established their own patrol teams. Every year, these veteran hunters harvest dozens of hunting traps from the mountains.

;

;The patrol team in Xinyi Village was naturally led by Zhong Jun. This old man, who was both good and evil, organized eight old hunters to start an anti-poaching campaign. Others asked him why he did this, and he replied: I will do it even if you don’t pay me.

;

;“I was a little selfish at the time.” He confessed, “There weren’t many people in our ditch, just a few old people at the top of the house. People from outside came into my ditch to hunt. Whether it's digging for medicine or digging for medicine, all our resources have been taken away. We have formed a patrol team. No matter whether outsiders are hunting animals in my ditch or digging herbs in my ditch, I will catch you. I'm not allowed to pick it up and take it away." But for this kind of thing, "I have to have an organization to support me."

;

;;

;

;Zhong Junde’s home is in the mountains and forests. The mountain next to it was once one of Zhong Junde’s main hunting positions. ;(Zhang Lei/Picture);

;

;The village secretary firmly supports it. In the eyes of the secretary, this is an opportunity to avenge the shame of the "Widow Village".

;

;The "matchmaker" of Peach Blossom Spring also came at the right time. Taohuayuan also provides equipment to the community patrol team, including infrared cameras, batteries, etc., buys insurance for the rangers, and distributes uniform clothing. If the work is done well every year, the foundation will also give certain rewards.

;

;Locals said that Taohuayuan’s “matchmaking” approach allowed Zhong Junde to “turn what was previously ‘evil’ into ‘righteous’”. The same is true in Fushou Village. Qiang Qinggui, who was famous for hunting forest musk deer, became the captain of the village patrol team.

;

;The spear of the past has become the shield of today. The changing role of the hunter has changed the face of the mountains and forests, but time has also passed. They are all old. Qiang Qinggui is like a cheetah in old age. His strong muscles have begun to relax, he walks with a cautious gait, and one of his eyeballs is gray due to injury. The average age of Zhong Junde's team is nearly sixty. They are all looking for a successor.

;

;;

;

;Young rangers formed a team to patrol the mountains. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Picture);

;

;The little hunter has grown up. In the protected area, Taohuayuan is recruiting full-time forest rangers. Gan Mingdong, a former naughty boy, successfully applied for the job with his only specialty and love - mountain climbing. He is nimble and dexterous, and can move through the mountains and forests as easily as a monkey darting between vines. In the year he first became a ranger, Gan Mingdong patrolled more than 1,700 kilometers, which is equivalent to the distance from Mianyang to Beijing. The roads the panda has traveled and where it will appear have already been drawn in his mind. Every step of walking in the mountain forest, every hunting snare and animal trap removed, judging the installation location of infrared cameras based on their whereabouts, and capturing every rare animal, all turned a natural hunter into a natural ranger, " I feel that I still have some value." The young man who was "definitely going to jail" in the eyes of his relatives is now "doing something serious".

;

;People in the village have gradually seen the benefits of protection. Not only have they driven away outsiders who plundered resources from their own land, they have also attracted tourists who are willing to spend money to see animals in the mountains and forests. "That's how gold and silver are created." Zhong Junde understood the meaning, "It's what we used to call 'supporting the mountain and eating the mountain'. This means relying on the mountain and eating the mountain."

;

;In In the village, people now respect Zhong Junde for his ability to protect animals rather than harm them. This respect is even stronger than when poaching was prevalent in the 1980s.

;

;When and how did the change in concept occur? The improvement of laws and the improvement of people's living standards may be necessary conditions. In Wang Dezhi's view, what is more important is "seeing".

;

;"Everyone is increasingly convinced that if the environment continues to be destroyed, our descendants may have no future." Wang Dezhi said, "No kind of life can live alone on the earth. , because we cannot eat ourselves. If we regard every life as a point, there will be such a connection between the points, and you can always find a connection, which is the energy transferred from the outside world to ourselves. But When such a species disappears, it means that all the connections related to it disappear."

;

;After working in Laohegou for 10 years, Liu Xiaogeng went to Taohuayuan's public welfare protection in Xianghai in Jilin areas, where the main threat to ecological conservation is overgrazing. In the past, the protection of Xianghai mainly relied on law enforcement, but objectively speaking, the contradiction between protection and development will not be resolved because of effective law enforcement. Instead, the conflicts are accumulating year by year. Moreover, public welfare organizations do not have the power to enforce laws, which requires them to get involved in the lives of local people. Liu Xiaogeng mainly relies on "persuasion" to guide people to herd properly. 508 households raise cattle and sheep, and more than 398 households have "discussed" with Liu Xiaogeng. In order to avoid Director Liu from herding cattle, the common people had to go out in the middle of the night. As a result, Director Liu went to herd cattle at 3 o'clock in the morning. Due to "human sentiment", overgrazing in Xianghai Protected Area was reduced by 70% in the second half of 2022 - first become "neighbors", and then find a way to break the situation together, outsiders, indigenous people, nature, everyone is here On a line.

;

;;A moment of connection;

;

;Perhaps everyone in Laohegou has experienced that moment of (re)connection.

;

;The hunter who frightened forest musk deer encountered a panda that accidentally rolled down while building a road. All the workers on site, who were 30 years old or even older, surrounded the round animal, and every man wanted to touch it. The panda was frightened away by the touches from the men. Qiang Qinggui said, "The hair of giant pandas in the wild is darker than all black and whiter than all white."

;

;The longer Gan Mingdong works as a ranger, the more he likes to look into the eyes of animals. , reading their thoughts from it, he has seen the pure eyes of the newborn takin, and has also seen the twilight in the eyes of the old takin that died the next day when it was looking for its own resting place.

;

;Wang Dezhi’s moment came when a herd of takin blocked his car and refused to give way.

;

;;

;

;At the Laohegou Nature Conservation Center, a ranger encountered a takin while watching wild animals at night. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Photo);

;

;"At that time, I really felt that this place (Laohegou) had become a home for wild animals. , this is what we hope to achieve most, to return nature to nature."

;

;Judging from the encounter rate of animals alone, the protection work of Laohegou and its expansion area has achieved remarkable results. The original poaching and deforestation activities have been basically eliminated. Infrared cameras deployed over the past ten years have taken more than one million photos and recorded 120,000 minutes of animal activity images. Among them, a video of an Asian golden cat eating captured by an infrared camera has been viewed 500 million times online - it can be said that hundreds of millions of netizens have also established a connection with this agile and ferocious big cat.

;

;;

;

;During patrol on the mountain, ranger Gan Mingdong checks the field infrared camera. ;(Sun Xiaochen/Photo);

;

;Due to work arrangements, Liu Xiaogeng was transferred from Laohegou. In the early spring of that year, he encountered three hooded deer, one of which was giving birth. When the rangers passed by, the two free-moving hooded deer did not instinctively run away, but chose to guard the birthing doe. Liu Xiaogeng regarded this as a gift from ten years of forestry work, and he was satisfied, outweighing the sadness of parting.

;

;In the deserted tea pavilion on the second floor, the legendary hunter Zhong Junde overlooked his small courtyard and said that during the New Year, this was Huaguoshan - his child, who was adopted by him after his brother passed away. The children, his grandchildren, and the descendants of his sister's family were all gathered here. They have enough food and clothing, sufficient storehouses, and a safe life. At this moment, his arrogance completely faded away, and a face that had experienced the vicissitudes of the mountains and forests shone with the soft light of motherhood.

;

;We saw forest musk deer during night viewing. This was the luck that Ma Jianlai had been trying to encounter for three years since he was the director of the Laohegou Conservation Center. But we never saw the pandas drinking water by the stream. It is said that they were the most naive at that time. But there are moments of connection: after wading through a river filled with prehistoric white domes, walking uphill, the breeze blows, pink-white Sichuan rhododendrons fall on my shoulders from the air, and the bushes below my waist are covered with Full of berries. If you lower your head and search carefully, you can still see the lanceolate double tower. Near the stream, blue-purple Corydalis sichuanensis emerges from the cracks in the rocks. Its stamens have a rose-colored halo.
