Wed, 25 Oct 2023 10:55:04 +0800 为何偏偏喜欢你——纪念陈百强去世三十年http://www.infzm.com/contents/259244
;;2023-10-25 10:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Chen Baiqiang;(data picture/picture );

;

;;What do you want in life;

;

;On October 25, 2023, the 4K restored version of the movie "Encore" was re-screened in Hong Kong. It will also be screened in Xiamen as the closing film of this year's Golden Rooster Chinese Film Festival to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the death of starring Chen Baiqiang.

;

;"Encore" is director Cai Jiguang's debut film, starring Chen Baiqiang, Leslie Cheung, Paul Chung, and Weng Jingjing. It was released in 1980 and was Chen Baiqiang's first starring role. At the age of 22, he played the real role of Ken, a middle school student in the film, and developed various youthful entanglements with Paul played by Paul Chung, Gigo played by Leslie Cheung, and Julie played by Jingjing Weng. The next year, Chen, Zhang and Zhong starred in another youth-themed movie "Unemployed".

;

;Although Chen Baiqiang, who has been singing all his life, is as famous as his contemporaries such as Leslie Cheung and Anita Mui, he rarely appears in movies and TV dramas. In addition to "Encore" and "The Unemployed", the only movies in which he had more roles were "Merry Christmas" in 1984 and "An Autumn Fairy Tale" in 1987. Chen Baiqiang did not have this ambition, but these films have inadvertently become some precious records in his life.

;

;;

;

;1984 movie "Merry Christmas"

;

;In the movie, Chen Baiqiang's character settings are pretty much the same: a rich man, a good boy, talented, caring, Ambitious, youthful and loyal, and do not give up their ideals for money. In the camera, he looks gentle and elegant, with a slight smile on his face. But the years of hardening are still captured by the camera: in "Encore", the childlike facial features and the cheerful sunshine in the eyebrows have not yet bloomed. In "Autumn Fairy Tale", the red lips and white teeth have a hint of melancholy and an inexorable melancholy.

;

;In 1987, Chen Baiqiang's career had entered the second half. 1985-1986 was the darkest moment in his life experience. During this period, he was ill and everything was not going well. His relationship with the gambling king's daughter He Chaoqiong was opposed by the He family. The media was not very kind to him, with widespread rumors that he was infected with AIDS, then that he was schizophrenic, and then that he committed suicide. Sometimes the newspaper office also received a breaking news call saying that "Chen Baiqiang was dead."

;

;"How can I not mind if you call me, because someone said that I am infected with that disease. When I walk on the street, passers-by look at me like a monster, point at me, and say many things that cannot be done. The words touched my ears." Chen Baiqiang recalled. In response to the rumors, he took a test at the suggestion of others but refused to make the test results public. Perhaps as a countermeasure, he also wore a T-shirt with the words "I GOT AIDS" printed on it on the plane. This rumor was not completely broken until he was hospitalized in a coma in 1992 and the doctor tested negative.

;

;His album "Top 100 84" released in 1984 contains a large number of works adapted from European and American songs, and is unique in the Hong Kong music scene where adaptations of Japanese songs are popular. However, due to misalignment with public taste, none of the songs became his masterpieces. He put great effort into preparing for the concert, imitating the prince's appearance and performing wearing a crystal mask, but he was criticized by the media and public opinion. He said: "I have been depressed in my heart, and at the same time I found that someone would deliberately hurt me... I was very fragile at the time and attached great importance to external news reports. I didn't know how to fight back, so I fell into a confused low ebb. ."

;

;He then released the albums "Loving You Deeply" (1985) and "When I Think of You" (1986), but the company received little publicity for them and the sound was weak. The Hong Kong music scene has also changed from the original competition between Leslie Cheung (Kwok Wing) and Chan (Bai Qiang) to the one between Alan Tam (Alan Tam) and Leslie Cheung (Kwok Wing).

;

;These negative emotions condensed into Chen Baiqiang's face in "Autumn Fairy Tale" - delicate, handsome but tired. "Autumn Fairy Tale" director Zhang Wanting recalled that during filming, Chen Baiqiang performed very well and could usually pass it in one take. However, he always pursued perfection and chased the director to take another shot and another. "He is a perfectionist, always pursuing better and wanting to be the best."

;

;;

;

; Chen Baiqiang (middle) with Tony Leung (left) and Andy Lau;(File photo/picture);

;

;Filmmaker Chen Xinjian and Chen Baiqiang have known each other for many years and played Chen Baiqiang's uncle in "Encore". He believed that Chen Baiqiang was unhappy deep down. "That kind of unhappiness is like the core of the earth, burning like a raging fire. He has many happy moments and many friends, but every happy time is quickly evaporated by the fire." He said, "He has a lot of pressure on himself. The requirements are very high, and if the performance is not good enough, you will be unhappy for a long time. If you perform well, you will be happy for a while, and then you will start to worry about the next performance."

;

;Such emotions also appear in Chen Baiqiang's songs. In 1987, he released the album "Dream Man". The title song of the same name was "I Love Baiyun" he composed in 1980 - it was re-released with new lyrics added by Chen Haiqi. The original song "Look at the white clouds, free and unrestrained, hopeful, unpredictable, floating by, you can only lead the way, the dancing clouds, leaving in a hurry without leaving behind, floating in the distance, the back becomes more and more beautiful" has become "This dreamer is floating away. For whom, I have spent my whole life with a heartbroken heart. At this moment, I think that love is eternal. I have gone back and forth a thousand times in vain. I love secretly without stopping. I leave in a hurry and never stay. My back becomes more and more beautiful."

;

;The more widely circulated piece of this album is "My Story" composed by Chen Baiqiang and lyrics by Xiang Xuehui. After the composition was completed, Chen Baiqiang thought it was a reflection of himself. He originally wanted to write the lyrics himself, but was unable to do so. He described his feelings to Xiang Xuehui, and Xiang wrote the current lyrics. During the recording, Chen Baiqiang cried several times and said that the song was a true self-narration. "The face that hides the stories of the past, walking in and out of the day, the blank eyes peeking every day... Time continues to deceive me, there will always be a new day... The painful rumors are very tiring, the past has no trace, trapped in There are many walls, but no one can rebuild happiness from the past." This autobiographical song resonated with music fans and was rated as one of the top ten Chinese hits of the year.

;

;Four years later, Xiang Xuehui filled in the lyrics of another song "Life Cannot Be Determined" for Chen Baiqiang: "I don't pretend to be free and easy, and I can't distinguish between sadness and joy...Who knows my heart?" Hot, who knows that there is no need to say it anymore, I still want to be short of it all my life, I don’t want to expose me to others anymore, you will make someone feel lovable..." This song is considered to be a reflection of Chen Baiqiang's inner feelings at that time.

;

;Deng Ailin, a disc jockey of Radio Hong Kong and a good friend of Chen Baiqiang, believes that Chen Baiqiang is a very sensitive person and this is where he succeeds. He is very sensitive to emotions and can bring that feeling out in his songs. But at the same time, he is also very painful because he is sensitive and cares about what others think of him. "His music can come out, but his personal emotions cannot."

;

;"His melodies are rarely happy. Most of his music represents his character, which is relatively lonely." With Chen Baiqiang Summarized by Xu Riqin, who has collaborated on many albums.

;

;;

;

;The 1981 movie "Unemployed", Chen Baiqiang (right) and Leslie Cheung

;

;In 1989, Chen Baiqiang released the album "What I Want in Life", and the title song of the same name "Life" "What do you want" was rated as one of the top ten Chinese golden songs and one of the top ten golden songs of the year. His unhappiness is concentrated in this song: What do I want in life? I can never see clearly in my confusion. I didn’t expect that what I lost is already everything I have.

;

;"In the later period, Chen Baiqiang kept himself to himself. He didn't want to face people and lost his previous glory." said Huang Baigao, a manager who worked with Chen Baiqiang. Later in his career, Chen Baiqiang's original works gradually decreased. Chen Jiaying, his agent at the time, recalled that on the one hand, Chen Baiqiang was worried about his lack of creative power. On the other hand, the Four Heavenly Kings also appeared. He put more pressure on himself, and his creations decreased. "He doesn't always greet people with a smile. He drinks to numb himself in the later stage. Only after drinking does he have the courage to talk about his feelings and make himself emotionally high. In fact, he is a tragic figure, not a comedy." Chen Jiaying said.

;

;Since 1990, Chen Baiqiang refused to accept any job. Chen Jiaying once received a call from him late at night: I am at home, have a sip of champagne and take a sleeping pill. When he put down the phone and rushed to Chen Baiqiang's home, Chen was already in a coma. Fortunately, he was sent to the hospital in time and there was no danger. "After he was fine, I tried very hard to encourage and enlighten him. Unfortunately, he always had his own outlook on life. No matter how much I tried, he always saw things in gray." Chen Jiaying said.

;

;;

;

;In 1993, Chen Baiqiang passed away, and his close friends Anita Mui, Chow Yun-fat and others supported him;(data picture/picture);;; p>;

;Some media photographed Chen Baiqiang's residence at that time, located at Royal Garden, 9A Kennedy Road, Central and Western District, Hong Kong. It was built by him himself and was all black. Entering the room, the entire 2,000-square-foot area is almost pitch black: black carpet, black walls, black sofa, black dining table, black dining chairs, black marble candlesticks, and a shiny black piano. The only colorful thing is the wallpaper on the living room wall. painting, a work by the Italian abstract expressionist painter Adevor. The bedroom has black bedsheets, black bedding, black pillowcases, black carpet, black slippers, black cloakroom, black desk, black crystal metallic lion decoration, black beauty couch... Only the floor lamp is not black. The media described him as "very repressed." Chen Baiqiang also has a house near the Royal Garden. The style is completely opposite. The whole house is white. This was regarded by the outside world as an externalization of his melancholy mood.

;

;From January 30 to February 1, 1992, Chen Baiqiang held three "Farewell Shanghai Concerts" and announced his farewell to the music scene at the end of the year. Chen Jiaying recalled that the performance was very successful. "He was so happy and felt that he had accomplished something."

;

;On May 18, 1992, Chen Baiqiang was found unconscious in his residence and was sent to the hospital for rescue. He remained in a coma for 17 months. On October 25, 1993, Chen Baiqiang died of brain failure at the age of 35.

;

;;

;

;Chen Baiqiang;("Breakthrough"/Picture);

;

;;I just like you< /strong>;

;

;Ten years ago, in 1983, Chen Baiqiang’s career reached its peak. He released the album "I Just Like You". The soulful song of the same name was quickly sung by fans and ranked high on major charts. His status in the music scene has also skyrocketed. Musician Lin Yifeng believes that this song expresses the psychology of the crowd at that time: eager to be understood, but afraid of being hurt.

;

;This is the most widely circulated of his many golden songs, and it is also the one that best represents his characteristics: fresh, simple, and slightly sad. Compared with his various attempts in the future, this kind of soothing, gentle and noble love songs are more integrated with him. Represented by this, Chen Baiqiang is closely connected with the memory of Chinese music, which continues to this day.

;

;Singer and actor Zhong Zhentao analyzed that Chen Baiqiang uses the Qi method of Cantonese opera when singing. Coupled with his personal temperament, he is good at performing minor-key songs and can interpret old and traditional melodies in a modern way. When he was a teenager, Chen Baiqiang often went to see the performances of the Wenner Band, where he met Zhong Zhentao and Alan Tam.

;

;In 1982, Chen Baiqiang released the album "Talking", in which the song "Take Care of Tonight" was adapted from the 1961 classic old song - composed by Wang Fuling and sung by Cui Ping. After the Cantonese version of Chen Baiqiang's "Take Care of Tonight" was released, it won the first Top Ten Golden Melody Award, and the album sold more than 250,000 copies. At the same time, "Ripples" composed by him also won the Top Ten Chinese Golden Melody Award.

;

;Moving forward, his first album "First Love" released in 1979 has become very popular, and the song "Tears Flow for You" soon ranked among the top ten Chinese hits. Chen Baiqiang became an instant hit and became a popular star in the Hong Kong pop music scene.

;

;;

;

;Chen Baiqiang;(Information picture/picture);

;

;In Hong Kong at that time, he adapted and sang Japanese songs are the mainstream. Chen Baiqiang has adapted a few songs, including songs from Europe and the United States, as well as a large number of original works, which makes him particularly eye-catching among other singers. He is handsome, can sing and write, plays the piano very well, can also play the guitar, is good at drawing, and has excellent clothing taste. Such an almost perfect image made his popularity rise rapidly after his debut.

;

;People were curious about where he came from, and the results of the media exploration did not disappoint them. It was a growth history of a noble son that met people's expectations: On September 7, 1958, Chen Baiqiang was born in Hong Kong, and his father Chen Pengfei was. Founder of Jinbao Watch Company in Central. His father liked him very much and planned to train him to be his successor. But his mother was not a big family. Throughout his childhood, he and his mother lived elsewhere. Perhaps because of this, his personality is different from other children. He is calm and smart, likes to be neat and tidy, and is polite to others but keeps a distance.

;

;Chen Baiqiang has had a strong musical understanding since he was a child. He can hum the tunes of many songs after listening to them once. He learned to play the electronic keyboard and piano without a teacher, but he had no interest in studying and said that he "had a headache when I saw textbooks."

;

;In middle school, he was already a famous figure. Deng Ailin was the emcee at a school event and found that the girls were discussing a boy who was handsome, played the piano well, was self-taught, and could compose music. When the later singer Lin Shanshan met Chen Baiqiang for the first time at the third-grade dance of middle school, she danced in front of Chen Baiqiang with all her energy, just to let Chen Baiqiang talk to her. Chen Baiqiang invited her to watch a movie. She looked at Chen Baiqiang's profile the whole time and thought to herself: He is smiling, he has an expression, and he is showing his true feelings. Can she keep this moment?

;

;However, his father initially did not support Chen Baiqiang’s music dream and only wanted him to follow his example and become a businessman. The two quarreled many times until Chen Baiqiang was tired of studying and dropped out of school. He occasionally served as a guest singer for some bands, and sang in Winner's band and on the radio. It was also during this period that he met Zhong Zhentao and Alan Tam.

;

;;

;

;In 1981, Chen Baiqiang and Weng Jingjing starred in the TV series "Breakthrough"

;

;My father finally agreed with Chen Baiqiang's choice and sent him to the San Francisco Conservatory of Music in the United States for further study. In 1977, he returned to Hong Kong and happened to participate in the "Yamaha Electronic Keyboard Competition" and won the championship. Subsequently, he won the third place in the "Hong Kong Pop Song Writing Invitational Competition" with his self-composed English song "The Rocky Road". The following year, he once again won the third place in the "Hong Kong Pop Song Composition Invitational Competition" with his personally composed English song "The Sunrise". He soon attracted the attention of EMI Records and became a signed singer under the company.

;

;Musician Huang Zhan recalled: "In his "little demon" era (probably meaning that others are small and very elf), he often played with us, so his artistic ability, It’s better to have more people. Danny (Chen Baiqiang’s English name) has been playing the piano for two years and is already very good at it. I was a judge at the Yamaha Electronic Piano Competition that year, and everyone agreed that he deserved to win the championship. Because of his performance , emotional and delicate. There are many who compete with him who have studied longer than him, but none are as good as him."

;

;Chen Baiqiang has been taking selfies with his camera for a long time. In the winter of 1979, he set up his camera by a bench on the streets of New York, lay down, looked at the camera, and gave his future self a smile. He also went to the Greek seaside, set up a tripod and camera, and took pictures of himself smiling, with the wind blowing his hair and clothes, and the waves rolling behind him.

;

;Chow Yun-fat said: "Danny (Benny Chan) is just a big boy. Don't treat him as an adult, but love him as a child and cherish him..." Chen Xinjian commented on that time Chen Baiqiang: His sadness, coupled with his dark eyes, fascinate many young girls. He makes people feel like a protected, pitiful, kitten in the rain.

;

;The combination of various factors makes Chen Baiqiang’s image even more lovable. When Priscilla Chan was still in school, she loved Chen Baiqiang so much that she asked all the boys around her to wear Chen Baiqiang's hairstyle and make up to look like Chen Baiqiang. And she skipped class to watch Bai Qiang Chen's movie "Encore."

;

; Chen Baiqiang in this movie has fixed an ideal image of a boy: clean and thin, with short hair and a white shirt, bright eyes, a slightly sad smile, and persistence for his dreams. He originally only lived in every girl's dream, but he actually appeared in reality.

;

;If they knew his later life, how many people would wish to stop at this moment and say to him: "I just like you."

;

;(Reference materials: "Emotional Photos of Chen Baiqiang", "Remembering Chen Baiqiang This Way", "The 30th Anniversary of Chen Baiqiang's Farewell", "The Immortal Legend·Chen Baiqiang", etc.)

; Wed, 25 Oct 2023 10:25:03 +0800 从鼠头牛肉到鼠头鸭脖：校园食堂安全谁来负责？丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/259224
;;2023-10-25 09:00:00;
;

;On October 23, 2023, in response to the food safety incidents that occurred at North China University of Science and Technology and Jiangxi Industrial Vocational and Technical College, The Food Safety Office of the State Council interviewed the main responsible persons of the governments of Tangshan, Hebei and Nanchang, Jiangxi, and required the local governments to strictly implement their territorial management responsibilities and resolutely maintain the bottom line of campus food safety.

;

;The food safety incident at Jiangxi Vocational College of Technology in early June 2023 caused a sensation on the entire Internet, and even gave birth to the new term "rat head and duck neck". The North China University of Science and Technology food safety incident occurred recently on October 10. The same student ate something suspected to be a rat head in the canteen. The store claimed it was beef. Different from the "rat-headed duck-necked incident", North China University of Science and Technology issued an announcement on the same day, admitting that food hygiene problems occurred in the school cafeteria, and terminated the entrusted operation contract with the relevant company.

;

;The appearance of rats in the kitchen of the canteen is nothing new. If the kitchen is not cleaned well, it is easy to attract rats. The canteen of Jiangxi Polytechnic College has been punished for this before. But the appearance of rat heads in meals is really shocking and incomprehensible: How irresponsible must one be for food safety to turn a blind eye to rats in meals? These two campus food safety incidents alarmed the Food Safety Office of the State Council, and they interviewed the main responsible persons of the local government. The high standards showed the serious nature of the incidents.

;

;Food is the most important thing for the people. Food safety is a top priority. According to the definition of the Food Safety Law, food safety means that food is non-toxic and harmless, meets appropriate nutritional requirements, and does not cause any acute, subacute or chronic harm to human health. This is the minimum requirement for food. Food cannot contain harmful bacteria, viruses and other microorganisms, nor can it contain toxic and harmful chemicals. Of course, there should be no vector organisms like mice that can carry bacteria, viruses, parasites and other hundreds of pathogens.

;

;The country has always attached great importance to food safety. In September, when the school year just started, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Public Security, and the National Health Commission jointly issued a document calling for effective strengthening of school food safety work. Less than a month later, the rat head beef incident occurred in the canteen of North China University of Science and Technology in Tangshan. The cafeteria management company "committed crimes against the wind". On the surface, it is a problem with the company that operates the cafeteria, but in fact, there are huge loopholes in the logistics management of the university.

;

;The canteens of North China University of Science and Technology and Jiangxi Vocational College of Technology, two universities that have been exposed to food safety problems, are outsourced to third-party companies. But even if it is outsourced, the school still has the first responsibility for the food safety in the canteen and should effectively supervise the third-party company to ensure food safety. But in reality, many colleges and universities often become "hands-off shopkeepers" after outsourcing their canteens. They are indifferent to the daily management of the canteen. If there is a problem, they put all the blame on the supplier and terminate the contract.

;

;As we all know, business in schools is good business. Canteens on campuses of primary and secondary schools can sell them for astronomical prices, let alone universities. Whether it is an ordinary university such as North China University of Science and Technology or a higher vocational college such as Jiangxi Polytechnic College, in addition to enjoying tax benefits, its canteens may also receive subsidies from the government, and the customer base is very stable. Although the food in school cafeterias is generally cheaper than in the outside market, there is still considerable profit margin, so there are still many companies vying to bid for the operation of university cafeterias.

;

;During the bidding process and the operation process after winning the bid, are there any hidden exchanges of interests between the operating company and the school's logistics managers? After the incident involving a rat with a duck's neck at Jiangxi Vocational College of Technology, the school initially vigorously defended the contractor, immediately reporting that the rat's head was a duck's neck, and forcing students who discovered the problem to write a written explanation to "clarify." This series of operations makes it difficult not to have doubts.

;

;In addition to schools, local government departments are also responsible for supervising food safety in school cafeterias. During this interview, the Food Safety Office of the State Council pointed out that there are problems such as the weakening of territorial management responsibilities for food safety in the two places and the absence of industry management responsibilities of competent authorities. Food safety is the legal responsibility of the market supervision department, and the market supervision bureau should perform supervisory duties on all food business units within its jurisdiction, including local school canteens. However, in the Jiangxi Polytechnic College incident, the local Municipal Supervision Bureau not only failed to strictly perform its duties, but also spoke nonsense and endorsed the school.

;

;In reality, most universities are at a higher level, and local regulatory authorities may have difficulties in daily supervision. For example, North China University of Science and Technology is a key university in Hebei Province and a department-level unit. Jiangxi Vocational College is also a higher vocational college in Jiangxi Province. The administrative level of these schools is higher than that of the local municipal supervision department. Even the person in charge of the logistics management department may have a higher level than the local supervision department. For example, the director of the Changdong Branch of the Market Supervision Bureau of Nanchang High-tech Zone, who endorsed the canteen of Jiangxi Polytechnic College, is only at the department level, while the leader of the logistics department of Jiangxi Polytechnic College is at least a division-level cadre.

;

;However, territorial management and industry management responsibilities should not be weakened or absent due to their level. Universities, regardless of their level, should accept the supervision of relevant local departments. Similarly, local regulatory authorities should treat units within their jurisdiction equally and strictly supervise them regardless of their level. In the case of the rat-headed duck-neck incident at Jiangxi Vocational College of Technology, a joint investigation team composed of Jiangxi provincial departments stated in the investigation report that relevant responsible units and responsible persons, such as the school and the local municipal supervisory branch, will be severely dealt with in accordance with laws and regulations. But almost half a year has passed, and there is still no information on whether and how the relevant responsible persons have been dealt with. And if there is no serious accountability for those responsible for supervision negligence, I am afraid that food safety supervision in school cafeterias will still be empty talk.

;

;;

;

;The Palme d'Or award-winning work "Anatomy of Death from a Fall" at the 2023 Cannes Film Festival is like a juggler throwing three balls at the same time. The execution is dazzling. It is both a strong plot thriller about an unsolved case and a family film about a broken marriage. In terms of scene presentation, it is also a legal drama in which all dramatic conflicts occur in the courtroom. Director Justine Trier is indispensable for being able to accomplish these three missions at the same time. The Cannes jury awarded her the grand prize undoubtedly in recognition of these visible advantages.

;

;Under the surface text, "Analysis of Death from Falling from a Building" (;hereinafter referred to as "Falling from a Building"; ) also hides some more complex and even theoretical intellectual issues. How can we distinguish between truth and falsehood when we cannot grasp the whole story? When truth and narrative come into conflict, can we persist in our pursuit of the former, or will we be conquered by the emotional power of the latter? From "Battle of Solferreno" to "Sibyl", director Trier has been obsessed with exploring the complex relationship between text and reality. However, in "Falling", which seems to be a straightforward commercial genre film, she has pushed her reflection on "narration" to the extreme.

;

;A famous bisexual female writer who is stuck in the quagmire of an unhappy marriage is seizing a rare opportunity to be interviewed by a girl from the literature department, and flirting with her ambiguously while drinking. But noisy music was playing upstairs at this moment: her husband - a man who had just resigned from his university teaching position and tried to write full-time like his wife - was aware of his wife's schedule and deliberately did not want his wife's (;Interview and Flirtation;) plan succeeded. The interview had to be interrupted, and the girl and the son of the family left one after another to avoid the embarrassing and noisy situation. When the visually impaired son came home from a walk, the guide dog that led him first discovered the shocking fact: the music was still playing, the sun was still shining in the Alpine sky, but the child's father had blood all over his head. He fell into the snow and died.

;

;Is it suicide, accident or homicide? The medical examiner could not find sufficient evidence to prove or rule out any of these possibilities, so the only person present at the time of the incident, the deceased's wife Sandra, was accused of being a suspect and had to be investigated. In the next two hours of this film, we have to work with the judge, lawyers, jury and son Daniel who was unable to witness the scene to find the truth through our own eyes and clues provided by all parties. In this process, the relationship between Sandra and her husband Samuel will be cut into pieces and dismantled by a cold scalpel like the latter's corpse, and will face the most severe inspection.

;

;From the overall setting, we can see the organizational structure of the entire film. This is an intricate network intertwined by various relationships. Everyone is trying to determine their position in the relationship with others, but they are often lost in the flow and change of relationships.

;

;;

;

;where The most eye-catching thing is naturally the relationship between Sandra and Samuel. Through the few words and fragments of evidence in the court, we can piece together some aspects of this relationship before Samuel's death: it was due to the uneven shouldering of family responsibilities between the two parties, the imbalance in the sense of worldly success, and the social and cultural differences between the two parties. Differences in background, different emotional appeals, and fundamental differences in personality and attitude towards life, gradually fell apart. We seem to be watching another "Marriage Story" or "The Kramers". Neither party has made an unforgivable mistake. Everyone has their own reasons and difficulties. Even so, the two people who still love each other will still move forward. Resent and hurt each other.

;

;But beneath the surface, the film also constructs a more subtle relationship: the relationship between the audience and the heroine. The legal drama format, which occupies most of the film, firmly places the audience in the position of the jury in the court. Through the guidance of facts, reasoning and emotions, we pour empathy into one of the prosecution and defense parties. And together they share the same hatred against the other party. As the truth continues to be revealed and lies continue to be exposed, our trust relationship with all parties is also undergoing subtle adjustments: at first, we will instinctively resent the inference of Sandra's guilt and the prosecutor's lawyer who questioned her; As the trial progresses, we discover that Sandra is not as honest as we first thought. As a result, the emotional balance shifts slightly: every word Sandra says from now on will be more questioned in our hearts. At the same time, every difficulty issued by the prosecutor, even including the various questions they raised before, It also makes more sense in our hindsight. The strategic game between the prosecution and the defense in the film is certainly exciting, but the psychological game between the director and the audience, based on the latter's emotional identification with the heroine, is closer to the focus of the entire film and allows the film to retain suspense. The secret to keeping it until the very last moment—and even until after the film is over.

;

;At its true core, the film sets up ambiguous and complex relationships between texts of different materials. The entire film adopts a realistic audio-visual and narrative strategy, but whenever the prosecution and defense raise speculations and memories that cannot be verified by facts during the trial, the camera will start from the perspective of son Daniel sitting in the auditorium. It presents a "psychological image" with a highly subjective fantasy color. Sometimes it is a picture of the father committing suicide, and sometimes it is a picture of the mother punching the father in a rage. As these images accumulate, they finally become "reality" near the end of the film: Danielle testifies in person, reciting a suicidal monologue from his father's lifetime on the witness stand. However, the father's voice never appears in the flashback sequence shot by the director, and the son's narration also adds a bit of ambiguity that is indistinguishable from truth to falsehood because of this carefully placed misplaced detail. We can't help but wonder: Is this monologue his son's true memory, or is it a narrative he made up to the judge in order to save a family that is at risk of complete collapse?

;

;The film does not reveal the answer to us until the end. But the truth may not be very important. The judge was obviously emotionally moved by Daniel's words, and the situation was reversed. Sandra was acquitted, and Daniel also re-accepted this mother whom he might not trust, but loved enough. The most intriguing aspect of "Falling" is precisely related to its complex emotions towards "narration" itself: on the one hand, it retains ontological doubts about all narratives, but on the other hand, it unconditionally believes The emotional animal nature of human beings, thereby believing in the infinite power of narrative itself.

;

;Thinking about "narration" confirms the significance of this film being able to exist independently from similar marriage stories; as for the truth of the entire case, it may only be grasped by that language that does not understand the language but is insightful. In the hearts of Border Collie Guide Dogs.

;Recently, the Ministry of Civil Affairs and the Ministry of Finance jointly issued the "About Organizing and Carrying out Central Financial Support for the Central Financial Support for the Disabled Elderly People with Economic Difficulties" "Notice on Care Services" stipulates that the recipients of assistance are tentatively designated as elderly people who have been included in the scope of minimum living security, have been assessed as completely disabled, and have voluntarily moved into a nursing home. The amount of assistance is the difference between the actual charges for staying in a nursing home after deducting the minimum living security allowance and two subsidies for persons with disabilities that the elderly have received.

;

;According to statistics from a few years ago, there are more than 40 million disabled or semi-disabled elderly people in China, many of whom are also suffering from dementia, such as Alzheimer's disease. As the population ages, this number will only continue to increase. Data from the Ministry of Civil Affairs shows that as of the end of 2022, there were 280.04 million elderly people aged 60 and over in the country, accounting for 19.8%; among them, there were 209.78 million elderly people aged 65 and over, accounting for 14.9%, a year-on-year increase of 0.9 and 0.7 percentage points respectively. Increases of 12.68 million and 9.22 million. Due to China's sluggish fertility rate, the number of newborns has almost halved in six years, and the rate of social aging is quite fast. This has led to many social problems that require our serious concern.

;

;Based on the age and physical and mental conditions of the elderly, we can sort out the specific problems they face according to the timeline.

;

;First of all, when the elderly are still "younger elderly", their physical condition is generally better, and their ability to live, work and study has not significantly declined; there are also a few elderly people who have always been in good health and mentality. These two types of elderly people do not need or need the care of young adults for the time being and do not pose any social problems.

;

;However, as we get older, our physical functions and mental abilities will continue to weaken. A considerable number of elderly people will be driven by the instinct of seeking life and hating death, and they will turn to health regimens that claim to help health and longevity. They are particularly keen on health care products and health care equipment. It is not uncommon for people who used to be very frugal and spend two cents of a penny to suddenly turn into buying and selling or even spend a lot of money; there are also a considerable number of elderly people who long for the warmth and affection of family. Although I have no children or my children are not around, I feel extremely lonely. Under the meticulous care and emotional attack of the sales staff, it is very refreshing to spend money.

;

;This "elderly economy" is essentially a careful hunt for the elderly and "defrauds the elderly economy." The public prosecutor and the law should show their teeth and carry out a powerful crackdown to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the elderly. Children should also care about their parents' mental and emotional needs, make more phone calls and spend more time with them; if possible, try to live with their parents so that parents can enjoy the rewards of raising children in their later years, so as to avoid the situation of "the children want to be raised but the parents don't wait" regret. In this regard, some young people may make reasonable remarks, such as "small family", "independent space" and "border". If you have never accepted or asked for a large amount of financial support from your parents as an adult, and you have repaid your parents for their upbringing financially and emotionally, you may have the confidence to say this. But it is unjustifiable if you receive a large amount of financial support from your parents as an adult and then refuse to fulfill reciprocal responsibilities. According to natural law and customary law, parents have the right to assert their own rights.

;

;Secondly, now is the era of smartphones and mobile Internet, and many public transportation services, government services, and convenience services have become online and digital. A considerable number of elderly people have been left far behind in this era and have become "digitally disabled groups". They do not use mobile phones or use simple-function elderly machines, cannot understand how to use those apps, and do not know how to make electronic payments. On the one hand, the government and enterprises should reserve non-digital service channels for the elderly and provide them with guidance in a conspicuous way; on the other hand, the platform should demonstrate social responsibility and launch an "aging-friendly" APP version to make the operation quick, simple and convenient. Older people get started.

;

;Children should have patience and love for their digitally disabled parents, teach them to use the apps they need, or provide regular guidance and help, just like your parents patiently taught you ancient poems over and over again when you were a child. Like arithmetic, this is about feedback and feedback. In addition, parents should be alert to prevent telecommunications and network fraud, and should "not give any personal information, do not give money, and do not cooperate with the other party in any operation." They should inform themselves when they have questions or before making major financial decisions.

;

;Thirdly, as body functions and organs continue to age, the vast majority of the elderly will experience a stage of disability, semi-disability or even dementia. The resulting need for medical care will have a negative impact on the lives of their children. constitute a great challenge.

;

;The national elderly care strategy is "9073", that is, 90% of the elderly are provided with home care, 7% are provided with community care, and 3% are provided with institutional care. A 2023 Beijing survey found that more than 99% of the elderly in Beijing choose home care, while less than 1% choose institutional care. Therefore, except for some completely disabled elderly people who are supported by the government, the vast majority of disabled elderly people still rely on their children to take care of them. Children generally have to contribute both money and effort, and the most important part is contribution.

;

;Disabled elderly people can only eat three meals a day in bed or in a wheelchair. If they lose the function of their hands or have dementia, they need to be fed, just like parents feeding themselves when they are one or two years old, and they must also help with defecation. , wipe your body or take a bath regularly; use a wheelchair to push outdoors on sunny days, so that the disabled elderly can enjoy the sunshine and breeze, feel happy and refresh their spirits; lying in bed for a long time, you must turn over regularly, otherwise the blood circulation will not be smooth, which will lead to vascular embolism or bedsores. ; If dementia is superimposed, it will be even more troublesome. Some elderly people will have delusions, become violent, and even smear feces all over the house, making it difficult to clean up. The odor will also attract complaints from neighbors... Disability and dementia For the elderly, it is generally impossible to hire a nanny to take care of them.

;

;At this time, as the mainstay of the family, you are in middle age, you have seniors and juniors, you have unlimited responsibilities on your shoulders, everyone relies on you and you have no one to rely on, this kind of pressure It's unprecedented. If you add a mid-life workplace crisis, it will be even more stressful. Therefore, as aging intensifies, this social problem will become more serious. But it is obviously difficult to solve this problem with a "socialized" system solution that transfers costs to society, unless robots are smart enough to replace human care.

;

;Aging, two kinds of disability, and three major problems are all social problems that require serious consideration and treatment by the whole society.

; Tue, 24 Oct 2023 22:25:05 +0800 探访“山地之王”：高仙芝的高原足迹http://www.infzm.com/contents/259129
;;2023-10-24 20:55:00;
;

;;

;

;Aerial view of the Pamir Mountains;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In mid-August, I set off from Kashgar and cycled along the Karakoram Highway to Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Since my country’s Khunjerab Port does not allow cycling to pass customs, I need to take a transit bus in Taxkorgan County, check the bicycle as luggage, and continue riding after arriving at Khunjerab National Park on the Pakistani side.

;

;The Khunjerab Pass is 4,783 meters above sea level. On one side of the border with my country is the wide-open and wide-open valley terrain of the eastern Pamir Plateau. The climate is arid and the vegetation is sparse. It is rare to see a tree at the foot of the mountain. Surrounded by a courtyard wall - it is a family of Tajik herders; entering Pakistan, it quickly transforms into a valley terrain with surging rapids - this is a canyon cut by the Hunza River in the southeastern part of the Pamir Plateau. It collided left and right in the mountain knot formed by the intersection of the Karakoram Mountains, Himalayas and Hindu Kush Mountains, and fell rapidly. From the border line of Khunjerab Pass to the entrance of Khunjerab National Park where Pakistan conducts border inspection, it is a short 40-kilometer journey, and the altitude drops by about one thousand meters; from the border inspection to Sost, the Pakistani port ), a distance of about 38 kilometers, and the altitude has dropped by nearly a thousand meters - which is naturally great news for cyclists. By the time I rode all the way downhill to the Ganish village in the eastern part of the Hunza Valley, the altitude had dropped to about 2,400 meters, which was only half of the Khunjerab Pass.

;

;Not far south of Ganish, I saw a pedestrian rope bridge flying north and south over the raging Hunza River, and a warm current suddenly surged in my heart - more than 1,200 years ago , Gao Xianzhi, a famous general in the Tang Dynasty, used a similar rope bridge in the lower reaches of this river to block the way of the fierce enemy troops.

;

;;

;

;A pedestrian rope bridge over the Hunza River;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;

;;Kashmir's "Great Game": Smoke and dust flying to the west of Jinshan Mountain;

;

;Before Gao Xianzhi rushed to the rope bridge, the prospect of the expeditionary force he commanded was not good: facing a surrendering enemy The fortified city, as well as a large number of enemy reinforcements coming all the way, while our own army has been on the march for more than three months, traveled more than 1,500 kilometers, and faced the extremely harsh geological and climatic conditions in Congling (; After continuous fighting in the wind and snow, the lone expeditionary force advanced deeply into the enemy's territory. They did not understand the language, had no siege equipment, lacked logistical supplies, and could not get reinforcements.

;

;Such a difficult situation may have been encountered by Alexander the Great during his legendary expedition to Asia and Europe. However, Alexander stationed his troops to the west of Congling and never crossed over. Gao Xianzhi's mission was precisely to cross the Congling to regain the lost territory. What's more, his military strength, animal power and material resources were far less than Alexander's expeditionary force. This may be why Gao Xianzhi later He was called the "King of the Mountains" by one of his rivals, Sahib jibal al-Sin. Sahib is the Turkic word for "master" , jibal is "mountain" in Arabic, and al-Sin is of China); reason.

;

;Gao Xianzhi is a descendant of the Goguryeo royal family. His ancestors were the Fuyu people who emerged in the Hunjiang River Basin and the middle reaches of the Yalu River in Northeast China. "Gao was their surname" and established the Goguryeo regime during the Western Han Dynasty, which lasted seven hundred years. For a long time, it once occupied Liaodong to the southwest, and then crossed the Yalu River to the southeast and entered the Korean Peninsula. After the Goguryeo regime perished under the military attacks of the Sui and Tang dynasties, the Tang Dynasty moved the defeated Gao royal family to the Central Plains and Longyou. Gao Xianzhi followed his father Gao Sheji into the army and became a border guard in the Tang Dynasty. He grew up in the Hexi Corridor. He grew up in a military camp, and when he was a boy, he was transferred to the Anxi Protectorate with his father, which is today's southern Xinjiang, Pamir Plateau and Central Asia Hezhong region. He rose to prominence in his twenties and was promoted to general, the same level as his father. Later, he was further recognized by the leader of the Qiang people and the governor of Anxi, Meng Lingjin, and was promoted to deputy governor of Anxi and commander of the four towns. The horse envoy is equivalent to Fumeng Lingjin's deputy and the military chief of the entire southern Xinjiang.

;

;In the sixth year of Tianbao; (747 AD);, Gao Xianzhi received an edict from Emperor Xuanzong of the Tang Dynasty, appointing him In order to serve as a military envoy, I made my fourth expedition to Congling after the failure of my three predecessors to recapture Xiaobolu - the Pakistani-controlled Kashmir where I rode to.

;

;;

;

;Cycling in Hunza, Pakistan;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Today's Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (Gilgit-Baltistan) is divided into two parts, Gilgit and Baltistan. The origin of the division can be traced back to the Greater and Lesser Bulu. The original name of this place was Boloristan, which means "mountain country", where "stan" means "country" in Turkic language. Today, there are five "stan" countries in Central Asia, including Kazakhstan, and Pakistan in South Asia; Bolor means plateau and mountainous area - this place name is famous in the Western Regions of the Tang Dynasty and is translated as "Bolu". It is the junction area of ​​the four kingdoms of Tang, Tubo, Tianzhu and Dashi, and is divided into the western and western regions. Xiao Bolu in the Sa Valley and Big Bolu in the upper reaches of the Indus River in the east - the goal of Gao Xianzhi's expedition was Xiao Bolu.

;

;The Big and Little Bolu were originally one country, and their territory included most of today's Pakistan-controlled Kashmir and the northern part of Indian-controlled Kashmir. It was a must-win place for Tubo in its Western Region strategy. At the beginning of the seventh century, Tubo annexed the ancient Shangshung Kingdom in the Ali region and unified the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. From then on, it began to implement its Western Region strategy based on the Ali region, and launched a nearly two-year-long war with the Tang Dynasty around Bolu, that is, the Kashmir region. The "Great Game" between Tang and Tibet for centuries.

;

;;

;

;Hunza Valley;(Wang Zaitian/Photo);

;
